        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5202e7d0af95fc9fc82c5a29e11ba5755c91cda2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5202e7d0af95fc9fc82c5a29e11ba5755c91cda2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5202e7d0af95fc9fc82c5a29e11ba5755c91cda2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>5202e7d0af95fc9fc82c5a29e11ba5755c91cda2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5202e7d0af95fc9fc82c5a29e11ba5755c91cda2"><!---->5202e7d0af95fc9fc82c5a29e11ba5755c91cda2<!----></a><br>Author: Ben Kelly <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ben Kelly &lt;<!----></span>wanderview@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/wanderview@chromium.org"><!---->wanderview@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Jan 26 16:59:12 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Jan 26 16:59:12 2022<!----></span><br><br>WebLocks: Use RPHI.instance_weak_factory_ when getting quota bucket.<span class="line"><!---->WebLocks: Use RPHI.instance_weak_factory_ when getting quota bucket.<!----></span><br><br>RenderProcessHostImpl has two different WeakPtrFactory members.  The<span class="line"><!---->RenderProcessHostImpl has two different WeakPtrFactory members.  The<!----></span><br>`instance_weak_factory_` gets invalidated whenever the renderer process<span class="line"><!---->`instance_weak_factory_` gets invalidated whenever the renderer process<!----></span><br>dies or the RPHI begins async destruction.  This is the correct<span class="line"><!---->dies or the RPHI begins async destruction.  This is the correct<!----></span><br>semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<span class="line"><!---->semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<!----></span><br>binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<span class="line"><!---->binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<!----></span><br>start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<span class="line"><!---->start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<!----></span><br>the StoragePartitionImpl.<span class="line"><!---->the StoragePartitionImpl.<!----></span><br><br>Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<span class="line"><!---->Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<!----></span><br>member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<span class="line"><!---->member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<!----></span><br>readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory objects.<span class="line"><!---->readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory objects.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>5c1a8da60506e80f9241c8ff6dd8736a9e340205<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Sorry, we could track this report down anywhere on clusterfuzz unfortunately. The fuzzer bonus is rewarded when your fuzzer running on ClusterFuzz automatically produces the report complete with test case, data from reproduction, such as symbolized stack trace and mitigating the need for a lot of security and developer time to reproduce and hunt for relevant data.<span class="line"><!---->Sorry, we could track this report down anywhere on clusterfuzz unfortunately. The fuzzer bonus is rewarded when your fuzzer running on ClusterFuzz automatically produces the report complete with test case, data from reproduction, such as symbolized stack trace and mitigating the need for a lot of security and developer time to reproduce and hunt for relevant data.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          flex-direction: column;

        }

      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

          width: 100%;

        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }

          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;

        }

        mr-issue-page {

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>


      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        I'm not able to repro on Windows asan - is it possible this is a shutdown crash or that specific user interaction is required (I see a rtc share request come up?)<span class="line"><!---->I'm not able to repro on Windows asan - is it possible this is a shutdown crash or that specific user interaction is required (I see a rtc share request come up?)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        If RenderProcessHostImpl has a raw pointer to StoragePartitionImpl and it can outlive the StoragePartitionImpl, then that is a bug in the RPHI architecture.  That raw pointer existed before jdh@ landed his CL.<span class="line"><!---->If RenderProcessHostImpl has a raw pointer to StoragePartitionImpl and it can outlive the StoragePartitionImpl, then that is a bug in the RPHI architecture.  That raw pointer existed before jdh@ landed his CL.<!----></span><br><br>That being said we can mitigate the problem here by binding a WeakPtr<StoragePartitionImpl> when we create the callback to the CreateLockManagerWithBucketInfo.<span class="line"><!---->That being said we can mitigate the problem here by binding a WeakPtr&lt;StoragePartitionImpl&gt; when we create the callback to the CreateLockManagerWithBucketInfo.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5c1a8da60506e80f9241c8ff6dd8736a9e340205<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5c1a8da60506e80f9241c8ff6dd8736a9e340205"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5c1a8da60506e80f9241c8ff6dd8736a9e340205<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>5c1a8da60506e80f9241c8ff6dd8736a9e340205<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5c1a8da60506e80f9241c8ff6dd8736a9e340205"><!---->5c1a8da60506e80f9241c8ff6dd8736a9e340205<!----></a><br>Author: Ben Kelly <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ben Kelly &lt;<!----></span>wanderview@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/wanderview@chromium.org"><!---->wanderview@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jan 25 17:53:55 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jan 25 17:53:55 2022<!----></span><br><br>WebLocks: Use RPHI.instance_weak_factory_ when getting quota bucket.<span class="line"><!---->WebLocks: Use RPHI.instance_weak_factory_ when getting quota bucket.<!----></span><br><br>RenderProcessHostImpl has two different WeakPtrFactory members.  The<span class="line"><!---->RenderProcessHostImpl has two different WeakPtrFactory members.  The<!----></span><br>`instance_weak_factory_` gets invalidated whenever the renderer process<span class="line"><!---->`instance_weak_factory_` gets invalidated whenever the renderer process<!----></span><br>dies or the RPHI begins async destruction.  This is the correct<span class="line"><!---->dies or the RPHI begins async destruction.  This is the correct<!----></span><br>semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<span class="line"><!---->semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<!----></span><br>binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<span class="line"><!---->binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<!----></span><br>start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<span class="line"><!---->start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<!----></span><br>the StoragePartitionImpl.<span class="line"><!---->the StoragePartitionImpl.<!----></span><br><br>Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<span class="line"><!---->Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<!----></span><br>member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<span class="line"><!---->member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<!----></span><br>readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory objects.<span class="line"><!---->readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory objects.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1288251<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1288251" title="AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free asan-linux-release-960248 content::StoragePartitionImpl::GetLockManager() content/browser/storage_partition_impl.cc:1493"><!---->Bug: 1288251<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I4b5fa6662e5c044558301acb1cfaeed620972370<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I4b5fa6662e5c044558301acb1cfaeed620972370<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3402620<a         Thanks.  From the stack it appears you are testing via some code modifications, correct?  So I think that verifies that nulling the storage_partition_impl_ pointer works, but doesn't necessarily test the WeakPtr changes.  Ideally we would not run a callback after async destruction starts, but that may be harder to verify due to timing.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks.  From the stack it appears you are testing via some code modifications, correct?  So I think that verifies that nulling the storage_partition_impl_ pointer works, but doesn't necessarily test the WeakPtr changes.  Ideally we would not run a callback after async destruction starts, but that may be harder to verify due to timing.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<span class="line"><!---->start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<!----></span><br>the StoragePartitionImpl.<span class="line"><!---->the StoragePartitionImpl.<!----></span><br><br>Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<span class="line"><!---->Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<!----></span><br>member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<span class="line"><!---->member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<!----></span><br>readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Congratulations, 0x74960! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $15,000 for this report. If you can point us to the fuzzer report or show evidence of this fuzzer being run on ClusterFuzz, we would be happy to boost this by $1,000 for the Fuzzer Bonus that is customary for valid reports from fuzzing. Thank you for this report and your fuzzing contributions!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, 0x74960! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $15,000 for this report. If you can point us to the fuzzer report or show evidence of this fuzzer being run on ClusterFuzz, we would be happy to boost this by $1,000 for the Fuzzer Bonus that is customary for valid reports from fuzzing.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ea0c3779fd0b20021d095809305cb2ed325a1da4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ea0c3779fd0b20021d095809305cb2ed325a1da4"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ea0c3779fd0b20021d095809305cb2ed325a1da4<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>ea0c3779fd0b20021d095809305cb2ed325a1da4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/ea0c3779fd0b20021d095809305cb2ed325a1da4"><!---->ea0c3779fd0b20021d095809305cb2ed325a1da4<!----></a><br>Author: Sharon Yang <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Sharon Yang &lt;<!----></span>yangsharon@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yangsharon@chromium.org"><!---->yangsharon@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Jun 16 19:50:28 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Jun 16 19:50:28 2022<!----></span><br><br>Rename weak_ptr_factory_ in RenderProcessHostImpl<span class="line"><!---->Rename weak_ptr_factory_ in RenderProcessHostImpl<!----></span><br><br>Make clear that weak_ptr_factory_ should exclusively be used for<span class="line"><!---->Make clear that weak_ptr_factory_ should exclusively be used for<!----></span><br>creating SafeRefs by renaming it and updating comments. Because of how<span class="line"><!---->creating SafeRefs by renaming it and updating comments. Because of how<!----></span><br>RenderProcessHostImpl gets cleaned up and destructed, it's important for most use cases to use instance_weak_factory_ to avoid UaF and dangling pointers.<span class="line"><!---->RenderProcessHostImpl gets cleaned up and destructed, it's important for most use cases to use instance_weak_factory_ to avoid UaF and dangling pointers.<!----></span><br>This change preserves the intent of <span class="line"><!---->This change preserves the intent of <!----></span>https://crrev.com/963512<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/963512"><!---->https://crrev.com/963512<!----></a> for<span class="line"><!----> for<!----></span><br>https://crbug.com/1288251<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1288251" title="AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free asan-linux-release-960248 content::StoragePartitionImpl::GetLockManager() content/browser/storage_partition_impl.cc:1493"><!---->https://crbug.com/1288251<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1294045<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1294045" title="Make the lifetime of a SiteInstanceGroup the same as its RenderProcessHost"><!---->Bug: 1294045<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>1288251<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1288251" title="AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free asan-linux-release-960248 content::StoragePartitionImpl::GetLockManager() content/browser/storage_partition_impl.cc:1493"><!---->1288251<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I667a9037347448a0646ad781ac7c81a45c7955fc<span           Tooltips show the reason.

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/99.0.4761.0 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/99.0.4761.0 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>#Reproduce<span class="line"><!---->#Reproduce<!----></span><br>This is found by my fuzzer running on ClusterFuzz, but it cannot be reproduced stably so ClusterFuzz does not automatically open a case.<span class="line"><!---->This is found by my fuzzer running on ClusterFuzz, but it cannot be reproduced stably so ClusterFuzz does not automatically open a case.<!----></span><br>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/6269252247814144<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/6269252247814144"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/6269252247814144<!----></a> (may require the security team to set permissions)<span class="line"><!----> (may require the security team to set permissions)<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>browser process(may cause the sandbox escape)<span class="line"><!---->browser process(may cause the sandbox escape)<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br><br>1. RenderProcessHost has a raw pointer to StoragePartitionImpl object[1]<span class="line"><!---->1. RenderProcessHost has a raw pointer to StoragePartitionImpl object[1]<!----></span><br>2. StoragePartitionImplMap is owner of StoragePartitionImpl[2] and will be freed when ProfileImpl get freed<span class="line"><!---->2. StoragePartitionImplMap is owner of StoragePartitionImpl[2] and will be freed when ProfileImpl get freed<!----></span><br>3. At this time, if RenderProcessHost access StoragePartitionImpl ptr, it will lead to UAF<span class="line"><!---->3. At this time, if RenderProcessHost access StoragePartitionImpl ptr, it will lead to UAF<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>// static<span class="line"><!---->// static<!----></span><br>RenderProcessHost* RenderProcessHostImpl::CreateRenderProcessHost(<span class="line"><!---->RenderProcessHost* RenderProcessHostImpl::CreateRenderProcessHost(<!----></span><br>    BrowserContext* browser_context,<span class="line"><!---->    BrowserContext* browser_context,<!----></span><br>    SiteInstanceImpl* site_instance) {<span class="line"><!---->    SiteInstanceImpl* site_instance) {<!----></span><br>  if (g_render_process_host_factory_) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (g_render_process_host_factory_) {<!----></span><br>    return g_render_process_host_factory_->CreateRenderProcessHost(<span class="line"><!---->    return g_render_process_host_factory_-&gt;CreateRenderProcessHost(<!----></span><br>        browser_context, site_instance);<span class="line"><!---->        browser_context, site_instance);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  StoragePartitionImpl* storage_partition_impl =		<<[1]<span class="line"><!---->  StoragePartitionImpl* storage_partition_impl =		&lt;&lt;[1]<!----></span><br>      static_cast<StoragePartitionImpl*>(<span class="line"><!---->      static_cast&lt;StoragePartitionImpl*&gt;(<!----></span><br>          browser_context->GetStoragePartition(site_instance));<span class="line"><!---->          browser_context-&gt;GetStoragePartition(site_instance));<!----></span><br>__CUT__<span class="line"><!---->__CUT__<!----></span><br><br>  return new RenderProcessHostImpl(browser_context,         If RenderProcessHostImpl has a raw pointer to StoragePartitionImpl and it can outlive the StoragePartitionImpl, then that is a bug in the RPHI architecture.  That raw pointer existed before jdh@ landed his CL.<span class="line"><!---->If RenderProcessHostImpl has a raw pointer to StoragePartitionImpl and it can outlive the StoragePartitionImpl, then that is a bug in the RPHI architecture.  That raw pointer existed before jdh@ landed his CL.<!----></span><br><br>That being said we can mitigate the problem here by binding a WeakPtr<StoragePartitionImpl> when we create the callback to the CreateLockManagerWithBucketInfo.<span class="line"><!---->That being said we can mitigate the problem here by binding a WeakPtr&lt;StoragePartitionImpl&gt; when we create the callback to the CreateLockManagerWithBucketInfo.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

The<!----></span><br>`instance_weak_factory_` gets invalidated whenever the renderer process<span class="line"><!---->`instance_weak_factory_` gets invalidated whenever the renderer process<!----></span><br>dies or the RPHI begins async destruction. This is the correct<!----></span><br>semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<span class="line"><!---->semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<!----></span><br>binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<span class="line"><!---->binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<!----></span><br>start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<span class="line"><!---->start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<!----></span><br>the StoragePartitionImpl.<span class="line"><!---->the StoragePartitionImpl.<!----></span><br><br>Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<span class="line"><!---->Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<!----></span><br>member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<span class="line"><!---->member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<!----></span><br>readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory         Thanks.  From the stack it appears you are testing via some code modifications, correct?  So I think that verifies that nulling the storage_partition_impl_ pointer works, but doesn't necessarily test the WeakPtr changes.  Ideally we would not run a callback after async destruction starts, but that may be harder to verify due to timing.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks.  From the stack it appears you are testing via some code modifications, correct?  So I think that verifies that nulling the storage_partition_impl_ pointer works, but doesn't necessarily test the WeakPtr changes.  Ideally we would not run a callback after async destruction starts, but that may be harder to verify due to timing.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

This is the correct<span class="line"><!---->dies or the RPHI begins async destruction. The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<span class="line"><!---->start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<!----></span><br>the StoragePartitionImpl.<span class="line"><!---->the StoragePartitionImpl.<!----></span><br><br>Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<span class="line"><!---->Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<!----></span><br>member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<span class="line"><!---->member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<!----></span><br>readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Sorry, we could track this report down anywhere on clusterfuzz unfortunately. The fuzzer bonus is rewarded when your fuzzer running on ClusterFuzz automatically produces the report complete with test case, data from reproduction, such as symbolized stack trace and mitigating the need for a lot of security and developer time to reproduce and hunt for relevant data.<span class="line"><!---->Sorry, we could track this report down anywhere on clusterfuzz unfortunately. The fuzzer bonus is rewarded when your fuzzer running on ClusterFuzz automatically produces the report complete with test case, data from reproduction, such as symbolized stack trace and mitigating the need for a lot of security and developer time to reproduce and hunt for relevant data.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Because of how<span class="line"><!---->creating SafeRefs by renaming it and updating comments. Because of how<!----></span><br>RenderProcessHostImpl gets cleaned up and destructed, it's important for most use cases to use instance_weak_factory_ to avoid UaF and dangling pointers.<span class="line"><!---->RenderProcessHostImpl gets cleaned up and destructed, it's important for most use cases to use instance_weak_factory_ to avoid UaF and dangling pointers.<!----></span><br>This         re <span class="line"><!---->re <!----></span>#c04<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c04"><!---->#c04<!----></a><br><br>#Reproduce<span class="line"><!---->#Reproduce<!----></span><br>I have patched some code made a stably reproduce env,.<span class="line"><!---->I have patched some code made a stably reproduce env,.<!----></span><br><br>chrome --enable-logging=stderr --v=1 --ignore-gpu-blacklist --allow-file-access-from-files --disable-gesture-requirement-for-media-playback --disable-click-to-play --disable-hang-monitor --dns-prefetch-disable --disable-default-apps --disable-component-update --safebrowsing-disable-auto-update --metrics-recording-only --disable-gpu-watchdog --disable-metrics --disable-popup-blocking --disable-prompt-on-repost --enable-experimental-extension-apis --enable-extension-apps --force-internal-pdf --js-flags="--expose-gc --verify-heap" --new-window --no-default-browser-check --no-first-run --no-process-singleton-dialog --use-gl=angle --use-angle=swiftshader --enable-shadow-dom --enable-media-stream --enable-mp3-stream-parser --disable-in-process-stack-traces --user-data-dir=test --enable-logging=stdout fuzz-00817.html<span class="line"><!---->chrome --enable-logging=stderr --v=1 --ignore-gpu-blacklist --allow-file-access-from-files --disable-gesture-requirement-for-media-playback --disable-click-to-play --disable-hang-monitor --dns-prefetch-disable --disable-default-apps --disable-component-update --safebrowsing-disable-auto-update --metrics-recording-only --disable-gpu-watchdog --disable-metrics --disable-popup-blocking --disable-prompt-on-repost --enable-experimental-extension-apis --enable-extension-apps --force-internal-pdf --js-flags="--expose-gc --verify-heap" --new-window --no-default-browser-check --no-first-run --no-process-singleton-dialog --use-gl=angle --use-angle=swiftshader --enable-shadow-dom --enable-media-stream --enable-mp3-stream-parser --disable-in-process-stack-traces --user-data-dir=test --enable-logging=stdout fuzz-00817.html<!----></span><br><br>#RCA<span class="line"><!---->#RCA<!----></span><br>I guess the problem may be related to cross-thread posttask, I simulated the post from the IO thread in the patch and reproduced the problem stably.<span class="line"><!---->I guess the problem may be related to cross-thread posttask, I simulated the post from the IO thread in the patch and reproduced the problem stably.<!----></span><br>From the log, we can find that GetLockManager will still be called after StoragePartitionImplMap is freed[2]<span class="line"><!---->From the log, we can find that GetLockManager will still be called after StoragePartitionImplMap is freed[2]<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void QuotaManagerImpl::GetOrCreateBucket(<span class="line"><!---->void QuotaManagerImpl::GetOrCreateBucket(<!----></span><br>    const StorageKey& storage_key,<span class="line"><!---->    const StorageKey&amp; storage_key,<!----></span><br>    const std::string& bucket_name,<span class="line"><!---->    const std::string&amp; bucket_name,<!----></span><br>    base::OnceCallback<void(QuotaErrorOr<BucketInfo>)> callback) {<span         If RenderProcessHostImpl has a raw pointer to StoragePartitionImpl and it can outlive the StoragePartitionImpl, then that is a bug in the RPHI architecture.  That raw pointer existed before jdh@ landed his CL.<span class="line"><!---->If RenderProcessHostImpl has a raw pointer to StoragePartitionImpl and it can outlive the StoragePartitionImpl, then that is a bug in the RPHI architecture.  That raw pointer existed before jdh@ landed his CL.<!----></span><br><br>That being said we can mitigate the problem here by binding a WeakPtr<StoragePartitionImpl> when we create the callback to the CreateLockManagerWithBucketInfo.<span class="line"><!---->That being said we can mitigate the problem here by binding a WeakPtr&lt;StoragePartitionImpl&gt; when we create the callback to the CreateLockManagerWithBucketInfo.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

The<!----></span><br>`instance_weak_factory_` gets invalidated whenever the renderer process<span class="line"><!---->`instance_weak_factory_` gets invalidated whenever the renderer process<!----></span><br>dies or the RPHI begins async destruction. This is the correct<!----></span><br>semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<span class="line"><!---->semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<!----></span><br>binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<span class="line"><!---->binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<!----></span><br>start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<span class="line"><!---->start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<!----></span><br>the StoragePartitionImpl.<span class="line"><!---->the StoragePartitionImpl.<!----></span><br><br>Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<span class="line"><!---->Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<!----></span><br>member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<span class="line"><!---->member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<!----></span><br>readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory This is the correct<span class="line"><!---->dies or the RPHI begins async destruction.  This is the correct<!----></span><br>semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<span class="line"><!---->semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<!----></span><br>binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<span class="line"><!---->binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<!----></span><br>start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<span class="line"><!---->start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<!----></span><br>the StoragePartitionImpl.<span class="line"><!---->the StoragePartitionImpl.<!----></span><br><br>Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<span class="line"><!---->Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<!----></span><br>member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<span class="line"><!---->member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<!----></span><br>readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Sorry, we could track this report down anywhere on clusterfuzz unfortunately. The fuzzer bonus is rewarded when your fuzzer running on ClusterFuzz automatically produces the report complete with test case, data from reproduction, such as symbolized stack trace and mitigating the need for a lot of security and developer time to reproduce and hunt for relevant data.<span class="line"><!---->Sorry, we could track this report down anywhere on clusterfuzz unfortunately. The fuzzer bonus is rewarded when your fuzzer running on ClusterFuzz automatically produces the report complete with test case, data from reproduction, such as symbolized stack trace and mitigating the need for a lot of security and developer time to reproduce and hunt for relevant data.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/99.0.4761.0 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/99.0.4761.0 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>#Reproduce<span class="line"><!---->#Reproduce<!----></span><br>This is found by my fuzzer running on ClusterFuzz, but it cannot be reproduced stably so ClusterFuzz does not automatically open a case.<span class="line"><!---->This is found by my fuzzer running on ClusterFuzz, but it cannot be reproduced stably so ClusterFuzz does not automatically open a case.<!----></span><br>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/6269252247814144<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/6269252247814144"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/6269252247814144<!----></a> (may require the security team to set permissions)<span class="line"><!----> (may require the security team to set permissions)<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>browser process(may cause the sandbox escape)<span class="line"><!---->browser process(may cause the sandbox escape)<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br><br>1. RenderProcessHost has a raw pointer to StoragePartitionImpl object[1]<span class="line"><!---->1. RenderProcessHost has a raw pointer to StoragePartitionImpl object[1]<!----></span><br>2. StoragePartitionImplMap is owner of StoragePartitionImpl[2] and will be freed when ProfileImpl get freed<span class="line"><!---->2. StoragePartitionImplMap is owner of StoragePartitionImpl[2] and will be freed when ProfileImpl get freed<!----></span><br>3. At this time, if RenderProcessHost access StoragePartitionImpl ptr, it will lead to UAF<span class="line"><!---->3. At this time, if RenderProcessHost access StoragePartitionImpl ptr, it will lead to UAF<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>// static<span class="line"><!---->//    BrowserContext* browser_context,<span class="line"><!---->    BrowserContext* browser_context,<!----></span><br>    SiteInstanceImpl* site_instance) {<span class="line"><!---->    SiteInstanceImpl* site_instance) {<!----></span><br>  if (g_render_process_host_factory_) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (g_render_process_host_factory_) {<!----></span><br>    return g_render_process_host_factory_->CreateRenderProcessHost(<span class="line"><!---->    return g_render_process_host_factory_-&gt;CreateRenderProcessHost(<!----></span><br>        browser_context, site_instance);<span class="line"><!---->        browser_context, site_instance);<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  StoragePartitionImpl* storage_partition_impl =		<<[1]<span class="line"><!---->  StoragePartitionImpl* storage_partition_impl =		&lt;&lt;[1]<!----></span><br>      static_cast<StoragePartitionImpl*>(<span class="line"><!---->      static_cast&lt;StoragePartitionImpl*&gt;(<!----></span><br>          browser_context->GetStoragePartition(site_instance));<span class="line"><!---->          browser_context-&gt;GetStoragePartition(site_instance));<!----></span><br>__CUT__<span class="line"><!---->__CUT__<!----></span><br><br>  return new RenderProcessHostImpl(browser_context, storage_partition_impl,<span class="line"><!---->  return new RenderProcessHostImpl(browser_context, storage_partition_impl,<!----></span><br>                                   flags);<span class="line"><!---->                                   flags);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>[2]<span class="line"><!---->[2]<!----></span><br>previously allocated         <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        If RenderProcessHostImpl has a raw pointer to StoragePartitionImpl and it can outlive the StoragePartitionImpl, then that is a bug in the RPHI architecture.  That raw pointer existed before jdh@ landed his CL.<span class="line"><!---->If RenderProcessHostImpl has a raw pointer to StoragePartitionImpl and it can outlive the StoragePartitionImpl, then that is a bug in the RPHI architecture.  That raw pointer existed before jdh@ landed his CL.<!----></span><br><br>That being said we can mitigate the problem here by binding a WeakPtr<StoragePartitionImpl> when we create the callback to the CreateLockManagerWithBucketInfo.<span class="line"><!---->That being said we can mitigate the problem here by binding a WeakPtr&lt;StoragePartitionImpl&gt; when we create the callback to the CreateLockManagerWithBucketInfo.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

The<span class="line"><!---->RenderProcessHostImpl has two different WeakPtrFactory members.  The<!----></span><br>`instance_weak_factory_` gets invalidated whenever the renderer process<span class="line"><!---->`instance_weak_factory_` gets invalidated whenever the renderer process<!----></span><br>dies or the RPHI begins async destruction.  This is the correct<span class="line"><!---->dies or the RPHI begins async destruction.  This is the correct<!----></span><br>semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<span class="line"><!---->semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<!----></span><br>binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<span class="line"><!---->binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<!----></span><br>start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<span class="line"><!---->start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<!----></span><br>the StoragePartitionImpl.<span class="line"><!---->the StoragePartitionImpl.<!----></span><br><br>Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<span class="line"><!---->Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<!----></span><br>member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<span class="line"><!---->member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<!----></span><br>readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory objects.<span class="line"><!---->readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory objects.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1288251<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         Thanks.  From the stack it appears you are testing via some code modifications, correct?  So I think that verifies that nulling the storage_partition_impl_ pointer works, but doesn't necessarily test the WeakPtr changes.  Ideally we would not run a callback after async destruction starts, but that may be harder to verify due to timing.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks.  From the stack it appears you are testing via some code modifications, correct?  So I think that verifies that nulling the storage_partition_impl_ pointer works, but doesn't necessarily test the WeakPtr changes.  Ideally we would not run a callback after async destruction starts, but that may be harder to verify due to timing.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<span class="line"><!---->start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<!----></span><br>the StoragePartitionImpl.<span class="line"><!---->the StoragePartitionImpl.<!----></span><br><br>Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<span class="line"><!---->Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<!----></span><br>member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<span class="line"><!---->member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<!----></span><br>readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Sorry, we could track this report down anywhere on clusterfuzz unfortunately. The fuzzer bonus is rewarded when your fuzzer running on ClusterFuzz automatically produces the report complete with test case, data from reproduction, such as symbolized stack trace and mitigating the need for a lot of security and developer time to reproduce and hunt for relevant data.<span class="line"><!---->Sorry, we could track this report down anywhere on clusterfuzz unfortunately. The fuzzer bonus is rewarded when your fuzzer running on ClusterFuzz automatically produces the report complete with test case, data from reproduction, such as symbolized stack trace and mitigating the need for a lot of security and developer time to reproduce and hunt for relevant data.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ea0c3779fd0b20021d095809305cb2ed325a1da4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ea0c3779fd0b20021d095809305cb2ed325a1da4"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/ea0c3779fd0b20021d095809305cb2ed325a1da4<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>ea0c3779fd0b20021d095809305cb2ed325a1da4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/ea0c3779fd0b20021d095809305cb2ed325a1da4"><!---->ea0c3779fd0b20021d095809305cb2ed325a1da4<!----></a><br>Author: Sharon Yang <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Sharon Yang &lt;<!----></span>yangsharon@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yangsharon@chromium.org"><!---->yangsharon@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Jun 16 19:50:28 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Jun 16 19:50:28 2022<!----></span><br><br>Rename weak_ptr_factory_ in RenderProcessHostImpl<span class="line"><!---->Rename weak_ptr_factory_ in RenderProcessHostImpl<!----></span><br><br>Make clear that weak_ptr_factory_ should exclusively be used for<span class="line"><!---->Make clear that weak_ptr_factory_ should exclusively be used for<!----></span><br>creating SafeRefs by renaming it and updating comments. Because of how<span class="line"><!---->creating SafeRefs by renaming it and updating comments. Because of how<!----></span><br>RenderProcessHostImpl gets cleaned up and destructed, it's important for most use cases to use instance_weak_factory_ to avoid UaF and dangling pointers.<span class="line"><!---->RenderProcessHostImpl gets cleaned up and destructed, it's important for most use cases to use instance_weak_factory_ to avoid UaF and dangling pointers.<!----></span><br>This         POC does not stably reproduce the problem as the problem requires winning a race condition(CreateLockManagerWithBucketInfo is called after ~StoragePartitionImplMap).<span class="line"><!---->POC does not stably reproduce the problem as the problem requires winning a race condition(CreateLockManagerWithBucketInfo is called after ~StoragePartitionImplMap).<!----></span><br>I'm trying to patch some code to make the problem easier to reproduce.<span class="line"><!---->I'm trying to patch some code to make the problem easier to reproduce.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1288251#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by

        If RenderProcessHostImpl has a raw pointer to StoragePartitionImpl and it can outlive the StoragePartitionImpl, then that is a bug in the RPHI architecture.  That raw pointer existed before jdh@ landed his CL.<span class="line"><!---->If RenderProcessHostImpl has a raw pointer to StoragePartitionImpl and it can outlive the StoragePartitionImpl, then that is a bug in the RPHI architecture.  That raw pointer existed before jdh@ landed his CL.<!----></span><br><br>That being said we can mitigate the problem here by binding a WeakPtr<StoragePartitionImpl> when we create the callback to the CreateLockManagerWithBucketInfo.<span class="line"><!---->That being said we can mitigate the problem here by binding a WeakPtr&lt;StoragePartitionImpl&gt; when we create the callback to the CreateLockManagerWithBucketInfo.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5c1a8da60506e80f9241c8ff6dd8736a9e340205<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5c1a8da60506e80f9241c8ff6dd8736a9e340205"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5c1a8da60506e80f9241c8ff6dd8736a9e340205<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>5c1a8da60506e80f9241c8ff6dd8736a9e340205<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5c1a8da60506e80f9241c8ff6dd8736a9e340205"><!---->5c1a8da60506e80f9241c8ff6dd8736a9e340205<!----></a><br>Author: Ben Kelly <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ben Kelly &lt;<!----></span>wanderview@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/wanderview@chromium.org"><!---->wanderview@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jan 25 17:53:55 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jan 25 17:53:55 2022<!----></span><br><br>WebLocks: Use RPHI.instance_weak_factory_ when getting quota bucket.<span class="line"><!---->WebLocks: Use RPHI.instance_weak_factory_ when getting quota bucket.<!----></span><br><br>RenderProcessHostImpl has two different WeakPtrFactory members.  The<span class="line"><!---->RenderProcessHostImpl has two different WeakPtrFactory members.  The<!----></span><br>`instance_weak_factory_` gets invalidated whenever the renderer process<span class="line"><!---->`instance_weak_factory_` gets invalidated whenever the renderer process<!----></span><br>dies or the RPHI begins async destruction.  This is the correct<span class="line"><!---->dies or the RPHI begins async destruction.  This is the correct<!----></span><br>semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<span class="line"><!---->semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<!----></span><br>binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<span class="line"><!---->binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<!----></span><br>start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<span class="line"><!---->start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<!----></span><br>the StoragePartitionImpl.<span class="line"><!---->the StoragePartitionImpl.<!----></span><br><br>Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<span class="line"><!---->Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<!----></span><br>member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<span class="line"><!---->member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<!----></span><br>readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory objects.<span class="line"><!---->readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory objects.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1288251<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         Thanks.  From the stack it appears you are testing via some code modifications, correct?  So I think that verifies that nulling the storage_partition_impl_ pointer works, but doesn't necessarily test the WeakPtr changes.  Ideally we would not run a callback after async destruction starts, but that may be harder to verify due to timing.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5202e7d0af95fc9fc82c5a29e11ba5755c91cda2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5202e7d0af95fc9fc82c5a29e11ba5755c91cda2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5202e7d0af95fc9fc82c5a29e11ba5755c91cda2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>5202e7d0af95fc9fc82c5a29e11ba5755c91cda2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5202e7d0af95fc9fc82c5a29e11ba5755c91cda2"><!---->5202e7d0af95fc9fc82c5a29e11ba5755c91cda2<!----></a><br>Author: Ben Kelly <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ben Kelly &lt;<!----></span>wanderview@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/wanderview@chromium.org"><!---->wanderview@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Jan 26 16:59:12 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Jan 26 16:59:12 2022<!----></span><br><br>WebLocks: Use RPHI.instance_weak_factory_ when getting quota bucket.<span class="line"><!---->WebLocks: Use RPHI.instance_weak_factory_ when getting quota bucket.<!----></span><br><br>RenderProcessHostImpl has two different WeakPtrFactory members. The<!----></span><br>`instance_weak_factory_` gets invalidated whenever the renderer process<span class="line"><!---->`instance_weak_factory_` gets invalidated whenever the renderer process<!----></span><br>dies or the RPHI begins async destruction.  This is the correct<span class="line"><!---->dies or the RPHI begins async destruction.  This is the correct<!----></span><br>semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<span class="line"><!---->semantics for the WebLocks use case since we don't want to continue<!----></span><br>binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<span class="line"><!---->binding the LockManager in either of these cases.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also clears the storage_partition_impl_ raw pointer at the<!----></span><br>start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<span class="line"><!---->start of deletion.  The async deletion means that the RPHI could outlive<!----></span><br>the StoragePartitionImpl.<span class="line"><!---->the StoragePartitionImpl.<!----></span><br><br>Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<span class="line"><!---->Finally, the CL moves the `instance_weak_factory_` to the end of the<!----></span><br>member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<span class="line"><!---->member list for order-of-destruction safety and to make it easier for<!----></span><br>readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory objects.<span class="line"><!---->readers to see that there are two different WeakPtrFactory objects.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products.         Sorry, we could track this report down anywhere on clusterfuzz unfortunately. The fuzzer bonus is rewarded when your fuzzer running on ClusterFuzz automatically produces the report complete with test case, data from reproduction, such as symbolized stack trace and mitigating the need for a lot of security and developer time to reproduce and hunt for relevant data.<span class="line"><!---->Sorry, we could track this report down anywhere on clusterfuzz unfortunately. Because of how<span class="line"><!---->creating SafeRefs by renaming it and updating comments. class="line"><!---->RenderProcessHostImpl gets cleaned up and destructed, it's important for most use cases to use instance_weak_factory_ to avoid UaF and dangling pointers.<!----></span><br>This change preserves the intent of <span class="line"><!---->This change preserves the intent of <!----></span>https://crrev.com/963512<a class="undefined" target="_blank"           display: none;

        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
